# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cog_del_c`
* Variable label: `Cognition - delayed recall - Continuous`
* Variable description: `Delayed recall of a list previously employed for measuring Immediate recall. The number of words is exactly the same as in the study-specific variable`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


* Short name: `cog_del`
* Variable label: `Cognition - delayed recall`
* Variable description: `Delayed recall of a list of common nouns. Discrete variable: value 0 = <=25%; value 1 = >25%.`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `Categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | <=25%
1        | >25%

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Delayed recall"
ds_label_cog_del_c <- "Delayed recall of a list previously employed for measuring Immediate recall. The number of words is exactly the same as in the study-specific variable"
ds_label_cog_del <- "Delayed recall of a list of common nouns. Discrete variable: value 0 = <=25%; value 1 = >25%"
```

# Data process

## HRS

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

The study-specific variables elected to be harmonised are:

* Name: `R1DLRC20`
* Label: `W1 DELAYED WORD RECALL`
* Type of variable: `countinous`

* Name: `R1FDLRC`
* Label: `W1 IMPFLAG: DELAYED WORD RECALL`
* Categories:
   + `0 = Not imputed`
   + `1 = Imputed`
   + `2 = NA-Not 65+, new IW, or alt wv`

```{r assign_hrs1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_imm','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1',
                         variables=list('R1DLRC20', 'R1FDLRC'), missings = TRUE)
HRS_imm <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_imm')
```

```{r local_hrs1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_imm[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- HRS_imm[[3]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = "Imputed") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Imputed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

The harmonized variable `cog_del_c` is the same than the study-specific variable but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`


To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**


```{r harmo_hrs1}
## cog_del_c
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_imm$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del_c <- recode(HRS_imm[[2]], "NA=999")
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del_c <- labelled(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]], labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))


## cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]], "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del <- recode(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):20=1")
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_hrs1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "Delayed recall continuous (with missing codes and non-imputed values)")
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("cog_del") + ylab("Frequency")


vari <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[3]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "Delayed recall categorical (with missing codes and non-imputed values)") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("cog_del") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstab_hrs1, echo=FALSE}
Continous <- c(sum(na.omit(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]])<=Q), sum(na.omit(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]])>Q&na.omit(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[2]])<900), sum(na.omit(HRS_imm[[3]])==1), sum(is.na(HRS_imm[[2]])))
Dicotomic <- table(HRS_ds_hrs_w1[[3]], useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(Continous,Dicotomic)
colnames(C) <- c("0:4->0","5:20->1","R1FIMRC=1->992", "R1IMRC20=NA->999") 
kable(C, caption = "Continuous vs Dichotomous (without imputed values)")
```

```{r read_hrs1, include=FALSE}
rm(HRS_imm)
```

```{r importOPAL_hrs1, echo=F}
label(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del_c) <- ds_label_cog_del_c
label(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cog_del) <- ds_label_cog_del
cog_del <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
save(cog_del, file = "../RData/hrs_w1/cog_del.RData")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

* `NA into 999`


To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**


```{r harmo_hrs5}
## cog_del_c
HRS_ds_hrs_w5 <- tibble(id=HRS_imm$id)

HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_hrs_w5[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

```{r assign_coda4}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_imm','HRS.HRS-CODA-w4',

```

```{r local_coda4, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_imm[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

The harmonized variable `cog_del_c` is the same than the study-specific variable but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`


To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**


```{r harmo_coda4}
## cog_del_c
HRS_ds_coda_w4 <- tibble(id=HRS_imm$id)
HRS_ds_coda_w4$cog_del_c <- recode(HRS_imm[[2]], "NA=999")
HRS_ds_coda_w4$cog_del_c <- labelled(HRS_ds_coda_w4[[2]], labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))


## cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(HRS_ds_coda_w4[[2]], "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

HRS_ds_coda_w4$cog_del <- recode(HRS_ds_coda_w4[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
HRS_ds_coda_w4$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_coda_w4[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

```{r harmo_coda5}
## cog_del_c
```

```{r harmo_coda8}
HRS_ds_coda_w8$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_coda_w8[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

The study-specific variables elected to be harmonised are:

* Name: `R4DLRC`
* Label: `w4 DELAYED WORD RECALL-AHD93`
* Type of variable: `countinous`

* Name: `R4FDLRC`
* Label: `w4 IMPFLAG: DELAYED WORD RECALL`
* Categories:
   + `0 = Not imputed`
   + `1 = Imputed`
   + `2 = NA-Not 65+, new IW, or alt wv`


```{r assign_wb4}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_imm','HRS.HRS-WB-w4',
                         variables=list('R4DLRC', 'R4FDLRC'), missings = TRUE)
HRS_imm <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_imm')
```

```{r local_wb4, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_imm[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- HRS_imm[[3]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = "Imputed") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Imputed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

The harmonized variable `cog_del_c` is the same than the study-specific variable but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`


To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**


```{r harmo_wb4}
## cog_del_c
HRS_ds_wb_w4 <- tibble(id=HRS_imm$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del_c <- recode(HRS_imm[[2]], "NA=999")
HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del_c <- labelled(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]], labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))


## cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]], "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del <- recode(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_wb4, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "DELAYED recall continuous (with missing codes and non-imputed values)")
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_ds_wb_w4, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("cog_del") + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- HRS_ds_wb_w4[[3]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "DELAYED recall categorical (with missing codes and non-imputed values)") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_wb_w4, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("cog_del") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstab_wb4, echo=FALSE}
Continous <- c(sum(na.omit(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]])<=Q), sum(na.omit(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]])>Q&na.omit(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[2]])<900), sum(na.omit(HRS_imm[[3]])==1), sum(is.na(HRS_imm[[2]])))
Dicotomic <- table(HRS_ds_wb_w4[[3]], useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(Continous,Dicotomic)
colnames(C) <- c("0:4->0","5:10->1","R4FDLRC=1->992", "R4DLRC=NA->999") 
kable(C, caption = "Continuous vs Dichotomous (without imputed values)")
```

```{r read_wb4, include=FALSE}
rm(HRS_imm)
```

```{r importOPAL_wb4, echo=F}
label(HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del_c) <- ds_label_cog_del_c
label(HRS_ds_wb_w4$cog_del) <- ds_label_cog_del
cog_del <- HRS_ds_wb_w4
save(cog_del, file = "../RData/wb_w4/cog_del.RData")
```

**R script**


```{r harmo_ebb8}
## cog_del_c

HRS_ds_ebb_w8$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_ebb_w8[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

## The Mid Baby Boomer (MBB)


### Wave 10

#### Study-specific variable description

The study-specific variables elected to be harmonised are:

* Name: `R10DLRC`
* Label: `w10 DELAYED WORD RECALL-AHD93`
* Type of variable: `countinous`

* Name: `R10FDLRC`
* Label: `w10 IMPFLAG: DELAYED WORD RECALL`
* Categories:
   + `0 = Not imputed`
   + `1 = Imputed`
   + `2 = NA-Not 65+, new IW, or alt wv`


```{r assign_mbb10}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_imm','HRS.HRS-MBB-w10',
                         variables=list('R10DLRC', 'R10FDLRC'), missings = TRUE)
HRS_imm <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_imm')
```

```{r local_mbb10, echo=FALSE}
vari <- HRS_imm[[2]]
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- HRS_imm[[3]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = "Imputed") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_imm, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Imputed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

The harmonized variable `cog_del_c` is the same than the study-specific variable but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`


To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`


**R script**


```{r harmo_mbb10}
## cog_del_c
HRS_ds_mbb_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_imm$id)
HRS_ds_mbb_w10$cog_del_c <- recode(HRS_imm[[2]], "NA=999")
HRS_ds_mbb_w10$cog_del_c <- labelled(HRS_ds_mbb_w10[[2]], labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))


## cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(HRS_ds_mbb_w10[[2]], "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

HRS_ds_mbb_w10$cog_del <- recode(HRS_ds_mbb_w10[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
HRS_ds_mbb_w10$cog_del <- labelled(HRS_ds_mbb_w10[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```
